content.title: Nirmaan Kamgar Mrtyu Va Divyangta Sahayta Yojana
content.beneficiary: Registered construction workers and their families
content.details: The Nirman Kamgar Mrtyu Va Divyangta Sahayata Yojana Uttar Pradesh is a crucial scheme launched by the Uttar Pradesh government for the welfare of registered construction workers in the state. It provides financial assistance to the families of construction workers in case of death or disability due to accident or illness.
benefits: Death Benefits for registered construction worker who die due to an accident: Total amount will be ₹5,25,000/-.
Death Benefits for registered construction worker who die due to natural causes: Total amount will be ₹2,25,000/-.
Death Benefits for registered construction worker who die at the workplace: Total amount: ₹1,00,000/- lump sum.
Disability Benefits for registered construction worker who suffer 100% permanent disability due to an accident or illness: Total amount will be ₹4,00,000/-.
Disability Benefits for registered construction workers with permanent disabilities between 50% and 99% due to accidents or illness: Total amount will be ₹3,00,000/-.
Disability Benefits for registered construction workers with permanent disabilities between 26% and 49% due to accidents or illness: Total amount will be ₹2,00,000/-.
eligibility: Applicant/Beneficiary must be registered with labor department.
Only family members will be able to get the death benefits: Depended parents, Spouse (Husband/Wife), Daughter, Son (Only if below 21 years old).
Death benefit will not be applicable in the case of suicide.
Deaths due to murder, snakebite, lightning, childbirth and other natural calamities will be considered as normal deaths and benefits will be admissible accordingly.
In death benefit claim of a construction worker, Aadhaar authentication of the dependent will be required if the dependent applies.
documents_required: Death certificate: A copy of the online death certificate.
Bank account photocopy: A photocopy of the applicant's Aadhaar-linked bank account passbook.
ID card photocopy: A photocopy of the applicant's Aadhaar card.

Accident reports: For registered workers, both the Primary Information Report/Panchnama and the Post Mortem Report are required. For unregistered workers, provide evidence of the accident, such as the Primary Information Report or a workplace accident report.
Disability documentation: In case of disability, submit a disability certificate and a First Information Report or medical certificate issued by the Chief Medical Officer.
Self-declaration: All registered workers/applicants must submit a self-declaration confirming they haven't received benefits from similar state or central government schemes.

faqs.question: What is this scheme about?
faqs.answer: The 'Nirman Kamgar Mrtyu Va Divyangta Sahayta Yojana' is a scheme by the government of Uttar Pradesh, to provide financial assistance to registered construction workers.

faqs.question: What type of financial benefits are provided?
faqs.answer: In two types, benefits are provided: 1. Death benefits. 2. Disability Benefits.

faqs.question: How much financial benefits are provided under death?
faqs.answer: 1. Death Benefits for registered construction worker who die due to an accident: Total amount will be ₹5,25,000/-. 2. Death Benefits for registered construction worker who die due to natural causes: Total amount will be ₹2,25,000/-. 3. Death Benefits for registered construction worker who die at the workplace: Total amount: ₹1,00,000/- lump sum.

faqs.question: How much financial benefits are provided under disability?
faqs.answer: Disability Benefits for registered construction worker who suffer 100% permanent disability due to an accident or illness: Total amount will be ₹4,00,000/-. Disability Benefits for registered construction workers with permanent disabilities between 50% and 99% due to accidents or illness: Total amount will be ₹3,00,000/-. Disability Benefits for registered construction workers with permanent disabilities between 26% and 49% due to accidents or illness: Total amount will be ₹2,00,000/-.

faqs.question: What is the procedure to get the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: Firstly applicant must register with the labor department and submit the application form with required documents to the labor department.

faqs.question: What essential documents are required?
faqs.answer: 1. Death certificate. 2. Bank account photocopy. 3. ID card photocopy. 4. Accident reports. 5. Disability documentation. 6. Self-declaration.

faqs.question: Is there any age restriction for the family members?
faqs.answer: There is no restriction for the members except the son. Benefits will be provided to the son if the age is below 21 years.
